title: Sainsbury’s has banned fireworks - and as someone with a lifelong phobia, I couldn’t be happier
text:
It’s a beautiful idea: an explosion of glitter and colour, lighting up the night sky. That’s why fireworks frequently feature in huge New Year's Eve parties, Fourth of July celebrations, Disneyland parades and the proposal scenes in countless rom-coms. It’s also why tens of thousands of visitors flock to places like Alexandra Palace, Leeds Castle, Chatsworth House and Kenilworth Castle every November.

Despite such magical public displays, however, fireworks can cause huge distress. If you have a dog you will know how jumpy and terrified pets can be on Guy Fawkes Night.

But it's not just pets. Many people hate fireworks. In fact, last year, 300,000 people signed a petition to ban the public sale...
